column3: str
Well met, friend. I'm Gisilbehrt, proud man of the Flames.
Ah, it's you. Drawn by the whispers of revolution, are we?
Ho, this is a pleasant surprise. Come to look in on the refugees now that they are free to return to Ala Mhigo?
I have charge of security here at Little Ala Mhigo, though that's just half of my duties. The other half is maintaining surveillance over the Amalj'aa encampment to the south.

So as to keep a closer watch on the lizardmen, the Immortal Flames entered into an agreement with the refugees. We provide them with relief by way of provisions, and in return they let us use these caverns for our operations.
Like you, I'm an outsider in this place. If you find yourself in any sort of trouble, don't hesitate to come to me.

This settlement was founded by Ala Mhigan refugees. When their nation fell to the Garleans, they fled in droves, hoping to find a safe haven in either Gridania or Ul'dah. Sad to say, most made it to neither.

For all intents and purposes, Gridania is ruled by the elementals, who turn away outsiders on a whim. As for Ul'dah...well, Ul'dah is ruled by coin. And so, having nowhere else to go, the refugees ended up here.

You'll find them to be a bitter lot, but that's to be expected, considering all they've been through. Don't be surprised if you're kept at a distance. That said, given time and genuine concern, they'll eventually open up.
A home away from home for the lost children of Ala Mhigo, ever since Garlemald conquered their homeland twenty years ago.
Gundobald's done his best to negotiate with Ul'dah on behalf of his people, and get them whatever aid and succor the tight-fisted coincounters will abide.

Aye, I may be a man of Thanalan, but my heart bleeds for them and theirs. Twenty long years─I can't even begin to imagine. But times are changing, what with some in the Resistance growing bolder with their words and deeds...
A home away from home for the lost children of Ala Mhigo, ever since Garlemald conquered their homeland twenty years ago.

But thanks to the hard work and dedication of the Alliance and the Resistance─and you and yours, of course─the imperial forces have been driven from Gyr Abania, and these good men and women are free to return home, if they so desire.

That said, many of them have built new lives for themselves here, and I suspect some are hesitant to pack it all up and move back to a place they left decades ago...or never knew at all. But I'm just a man of Thanalan, so what do I know.
What will you ask?
What do you do here?
What kind of place is this?
Nothing.
